name: Villa Belvedere

reviews.text: We booked our holiday through Cystal Italy after a recommendation from a friend and were not disappointed. The hotel was everything I had imagined - lots of charm and individuality which set it apart from the normal 3* experience. The hotel management were very friendly and helpful at all times. The rooms were immaculate and cleaned each day very throughly and quickly. The hotel's gardens are lush and proved a most relaxing experience - lots of little nooks and crannies to explore. There are a couple of patio areas next to the the pool which are worth getting up early for if you want a bit of privacy when sunbathing. We always managed to get a sunbed, even in the afternoons which was a welcome change. The pool itself is not large and if you enjoy a really good swim this will not win any points but very clean and warm. The views from the hotel are stunning and cannot be beaten. However, make sure you get a bedroom on the 3rd floor if you want the best views - our room was number 59 - private terrace with loungers and in my opinion, the best room right in the middle. We had to pay quite a large supplement but it was definitely worth it and the view at night was absolutely fantastic and very romantic. It definitely made our stay just perfect. Some bedrooms on lower floors mayl be obstructed with trees and could possibly prove frustrating. Avoid bedrooms at front of hotel as road runs past which although not a main road as such, can prove noisy as the Italians do like using their car horns rather a lot! Our room was not huge but had everything in it that we needed and the bed was really comfortable. We had to ask for extra pillows and these were provided immediately and with a smile. Breakfast was typical for Italy - I personally really enjoyed it and left feeling satisfied and ready for the day. If you expect egg and bacon, you should probably not be considering Italy anyway. The hotel is ideally situated for the town - only a short stroll taking you past the public gardens which are absolutely lovely on a hot day and well worth wandering through. I cannot fault the hotel. We have stayed in lots of 5* concrete jungles and this hotel beats them all. I would not hesitate in booking again when we return to Taormina which we definitely shall as we absolutely fell in love with it all. Take plenty of money as the whole experience does not come cheap but worth every penny.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in excellent prime location
Love this hotel
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel twice last year, once in May and again at the end of October. We were lucky enough the first time to get a fantastic room as we were the only ones booked with ItaliaTour. Our room was like a mini apartment with its own huge terrace away from the main hotel. I realise we were very lucky as other guests had smaller traditional rooms.

We chose this hotel from the reviews on trip advisor and we would say that it was fairly accurate, 3 star hotel, 4 star prices and 5 star position. Our room was as was booked with a balcony and sea view. The room was spotlessly clean, but it had the smallest bathroom that we have ever had, certainly not big enough to allow two people in at one time. We had agreed by E Mail that we would bring Euro travellers cheques as they had asked us too if possible, after arriving we were asked three times how we were paying. My husband told them that we did not want to be asked any more as we had already specified that we had bought Euro cheques and told them three times. Never before have we been asked this in any hotel.
reviews.title: A pleasant Hotel, perfect views

reviews.text: The breakfast was sufficent but we felt that some days they could have introduced ham instead of salami every morning (for those Brits who can't face salami in the morning) and fresh tomatoes with the cheese and hard boiled eggs. The food in the pool bar was excellent, well worth eating there. The restaurant that we went to most with absolutely fabulous food and wonderful people was Al Gardinos, it is a wonderful family ran business just up the road to the hotel and as it isn't in the main street the prices were so reasonable. The hotel staff were very pleasant and accommodating, but we found the manager/owner not very friendly, not even able to say Good morning, his happiest time was the day we were leaving when he knew we had paid on euro cheques. We wondered if we should have a sign on our heads saying " We are your paying customers"
reviews.title: Not as spectacular as we had hoped

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor we were expecting somewhere more spectacular than we found. It's definitely a 3 star hotel. However, it does have a great location with just a short walk to the town and lovely views (not as amazing as we were hoping though after reading previous reviews).
reviews.title: Loved it

We were lucky enough to have a large terrace (although we did pay for it) however we couldn't really use it in the day as it only had chairs rather than sun loungers and at night we hardly used it as there was no outside light although we managed to see a little with the room light on.
reviews.title: Broken promise
What a location!
reviews.text: This was our second visit to Taormina, our first visit to the Hotel Belvedere. The hotel itself is lovely. Appears to be family owned and managed, so there were lots of children and families. The views from many of the windows were incredible -- looking out over the sea and a vista of flowers. We have lovely weather, so the pool was packed with sunbathers, but there are lots of little nooks and crannies to take a book and hide. We were fortunate to secure a sea-view; our friends were not as fortunate, with a room at the back. It is definitely worth spending the extra money for the view; I'm not sure I'd want to stay here without one. The rooms are clean and well furnished, although not particularly spacious. This isn't a problem if you have a balcony or patio, but if not, things could get a bit cramped. Lunch is available pool-side, and is very good, though expensive. Breakfasts are great, with lots of choices. The parking is another story. There is a large driveway and small parking lot; all cars are somehow miraculously parked; looks like a jumble, and you really believe you'll never see your car again! As we were staying 3 days, our car was somehow moved into a corner; I couldn't watch as the porter got it out -- somehow, with no scratches. If I had it to do over again, I'd park in one of the public lots and then taxi to the hotel, so that at least I could feel that if I needed the car, I could get to it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our last 4 days of a 3 week trip here and loved it all. The staff was great, the rooms overlooked magnificent gardens, pool and the sea with Mt. Etna to the right. The parking area was quite small but the staff could efficiently get your car for you in 10 minutes flat even with moving 6 cars up a steep hill onto a busy street. They were amazing.
reviews.title: What a treat!!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel with a group (20 in all) of friends from 23 to 25 April. It is lovely and the staff on reception were extremely helpful and looked after us very well. Rooms with a sea view are lovely but some of us had rooms without a view and there is really too much contrast between the standards of the rooms for a group like we were. Some were bowled over by how lovely their bedrooms were while others were pretty glum.
reviews.title: A special hotel

likes.disliked: — Contrast between standard of bedrooms (if travelling with friends who compare notes!)

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights just before Easter. Our group was 2 adults and 4 children. After a very friendly and professional reception from the hotel staff (who thankfully parked the car in the very tight driveway) we were shown to our rooms (suite) which was perfect for a family travelling with yhoung children. There was plenty of space, a seperate bedroom for the grown-ups and it was very clean. It was also close to the swimming pool which our children loved. The breakfasts were FANTASTIC. Kept us going until a late lunch and the breakfast staff were really sweet to the children.
reviews.title: Excellent experience of staying with a young family

likes.liked: — Location, good friendly service and good room (and breakfast)

reviews.text: On the day we were leaving, after breakfast, we returned to our rooms
reviews.title: Sicilia Bedda!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to find enormous Easter eggs on all the kids beds. We left with really lovely memories of our stay in this hotel. Thank you very much Hotel Belvedere.
reviews.title: nice town average hotel

reviews.text: I'm a little confused concerning the negative reviews I have read because I loved this hotel. As an American that travels alot in Europe, it exceeded my expectations. We showed up after dark with no reservations and toddler and a 3 month old baby. They were very accomodating: parked our car, got us into a room and set up a baby cot swiftly, and were very friendly. They even made a phone call for us so they could act as a translator.
reviews.title: perfect place to stay

likes.liked: — parking, location, cleanliness, quiet, great view, friendly atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not get a room with a view, but the room was very lovely. In fact, our room faced this small courtyard, so it was especially quiet. The room was very clean and large enough for us, our luggage, the baby cot, and a pram to fit comfortably. The bathroom was larger than most. It had a large bathtub with stand up shower and a bidet. The room had terracotta tile floors, nice furniture, a safe, and a very comfortable double bed.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I loved the common spaces of this hotel. There was a very relaxed, homey bar area where you could make a friend or play a game. There were game tables in near the lobby (for chess or cards) and also near the breakfast room. I kept thinking how fun it would be to come back when the kids were older. The common spaces were also filled with nice furniture and decor. I thought it was very inviting. I did not swim, but the pool area looked nice and, of course, the view was spectacular.
reviews.title: Delightful

likes.liked: — The staff, the views and the peaceful atmosphere

reviews.text: I noticed on some other reviews that the travelers felt like they were hassled at check out and about how they were going to pay. When we checked out, they told us their credit card machine was down and asked if we could pay cash. We came back later after the day of sight-seeing and the credit card machine was miraculously working again. Not sure if this coincidence or some sort of regular scheme of theirs.
reviews.title: all depends on getting a room with a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over all I thought this a very lovely, family-friendly hotel, especially by European standards. I would gladly go back and recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Loved it

likes.liked: — The view from our terrace and the wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and requested a sea view room with french balcony. On arrival we were given a free upgrade to a sea view room with a full terrace, which was much appreciated! The room were spotlessly clean with terracotta floor tiles and comfortable beds. The bathroom was small but clean and newly tiled. We did hear some noise during the night but no worse than most other hotels. The hotel pool, gardens and common area were beautiful, as was the view of Mount Etna from our terrace. We found the service to be faultless; the staff were very helpful and polite in recommending restaurants, arranging taxis and so on. If we return to Taormina I would not consider staying anywhere else.
reviews.title: Amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying a night at the San Domenico Palace, we knew that it would be satisfied elsewhere in Taormina. However, the reviews for the Villa Belvedere seemed to indicate that it would be a good option. Although the pool area was very nice, the rooms truly were not. The room looked like it was decorated on a budget of $75 sometime in the late eighties (think wall mounted TVs and don't think flat screens!) The beds were just OK but the bathroom was completely unusable. I am a fit 30 year old and I couldn't stand in the shower without touching at least one of the four walls. If this hotel were 100 euro and you were on a budget, it might make sense. However, they charge more than double that (and they charged us 4 euros per towel per day at the pool. Are you kidding?!) -- just not worth it. Splurge on the San Domenico or Timeo instead.
reviews.title: Dated Decor, Bad Baths, Great Pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returnd from a fabulous week in Taormina. Having been let down by our original hotel, we found a room in the Belvedere, quite by chance at short notice and we were absolutely delighted. A small, traditional and very beautiful hotel, the rooms and facilities were immaculate. A lovely pool and excellent pool restaurant serving delicious lunches. The Belvedere has an ideal location not far from the main street, yet it's hillside location allows georgous views from the pool and balconies. A definite recommendation.
reviews.title: Delightful Hotel Choice for Taormina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a fantastic week in Taormina. You don't have a great holiday unless you have a great hotel, and The Villa Belvedere is one of the best we have stayed in. It has a very beautiful and quite discreet location, wonderfully maintained grounds, a relaxed and peaceful ambience, and very nice people working there. It's not all mod.cons. and if you just have to take you laptop on holiday, and have movies on demand while enjoying a drink from the mini bar in your room, then its not for you. But for a bit of old fashioned charm, wonderful views of the coast and Etna, and a nicely laid back atmosphere in which to relax, the Belvedere was spot on, in what I imagine is a very competetive market in Taormina.
reviews.title: Beautiful Belvedere

reviews.title: A room with a view

description: Hotel Villa Belvedere its a delightful and romantic hotel situated at 5 minutes walking from the center of Taormina. It's an ideal hotel for couples who are looking for a charm and relaxing oasis surrounded by a lovely garden always in bloom. With an amazing view of "Baia di Naxos" and the mount Etna Villa Belvedere its a perfect location for your Sicilian holidays.
